body.description: The XFX AMD Radeon RX 7000 Series graphics cards, featuring the groundbreaking AMD RDNA 3 architecture, deliver ultra-high frame rates for your favorite games

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 91 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a difference in gaming this card makes. At this point in time, probably the best card for the money.Just make sure your case has enough space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Being a Nvidia supporter all of my life, I was skeptical about buying a AMD GPU. I've said hurtful things in the past. I've been ignorant in my selfish ways. The RX 7800xt blew me away with its performance! And the price, It's unreal! It is right on par with the RTX 4070, maybe even a little better. I've experienced absolutely zero issues with my RX 7800xt so far, and I couldn't be any happier with it. I play everything on 3440x1440 Ultra settings, with or without FSR/FrameGen.Upon purchasing I received a code to download a FREE copy of Avatar : Frontiers of Pandora. The game is absolutely breathtaking visually, and also very fun to play.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very solid 2k and maybe 4k card
reviews.reviewText: I have had absolutely no issues with this graphics card. I have two 2k resolution monitors with 144hz and it runs nearly every game I've played on ultra quality. My average on ultra for most games is 180fps but this will be dependent on your CPU and other factors as well.I do not have a 4k monitor but would imagine you'd probably average at least 100 fps with my current setup and games.Overall a very good card rivaling (and maybe surpassing) the 4080 in nearly every way, especially in price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Running games on ultra!
reviews.reviewText: Awesome graphics card and great price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big step up from a 1070 - VR and installation tips
reviews.reviewText: It seems like there are very few written reviews for the 7000 series GPUs. Maybe that's normal for AMD. Either way, I want to share some info to make sure others have a smooth experience. I came over from the green team, specifically, an EVGA GTX 1070 SC. That card is getting long in the tooth, doesn't have a lot of the more modern features, and definitely struggled with newer AAA games.Getting right to it, this XFX 7800XT has been doing a great job. I tried Hogwarts Legacy on ultra with raytracing. That was stuttery, so I played around and could get pretty solid performance on high settings. I disabled ray tracing expecting much worse visuals. Honestly, I think RT is overhyped. I'll take all ultra settings with no ray tracing and smooth performance any day. Maybe RT is poorly implemented on Hogwarts? I didn't expect to see things like hanging spoon shadows in shops rendered well, but they were there without RT. The card itself has stayed cool and quiet. I haven't noticed it being any louder the the 1070 it replaced.I promised tips, and I feel these are very important. If you're swapping from nvidia, it's recommended to use DDU - Display Driver Uninstaller. I'll assume you're a Windows user for these tips.-First, make sure to check Windows Update for any system updates. Give the computer a reboot to make sure everything is installed and working before doing driver surgery.-Download DDU (it's free) and the AMD drivers.-Click Start, click the power icon, then hold shift while clicking reboot --> advanced options. Most tutorials show a blue screen with options right after clicking reboot. That must have changed recently because my safe mode options were the first thing I saw after it rebooted.-The goal is to reboot into safe mode *without networking*.-Run DDU to nuke all remnants of nvidia drivers. Make sure to tick the box that will reboot after its done. Windows will reboot, using a generic video driver.-Install the AMD drivers/Adrenaline software-Careful running Windows updates - Microsoft seems to think it knows best and installed a driver over the one I just installed, causing Adrenaline to be missing update buttons. If this happens, open device manager, double click the AMD display driver, go to the Driver tab, roll back driver. Your update buttons in Adrenaline should be back.VR tips (assuming Oculus 2 using AirLink)-Firstly, you may want to just use Virtual Desktop Streamer. In some (probably most) cases it's better than Air Link. I read that Virtual Desktop keeps GPU power draw up when not in use, so you might want to close that when done.-For Air Link, I experienced weird warping or distortion. The Oculus Debug tool can fix this (or did for me). Even with these steps, the Oculus software will complain that you're using an unsupported GPU - ignore the warning.-Find the Oculus Debug Tool - by default it is in C:\Program Files\Oculus\Support\oculus-diagnostics-Someone on reddit said warping had something to do with needing an Encode Resolution Width that is a multiple of 64. The value they cited (and I used) is 3712.-While you're in the debug tool, set video codec to H.265 - this helped with color banding in Beat Saber.-Click into another field in the debug tool for the tool to save what you entered. If you just enter the text and close, it won't save.TADA! You should be up and running! I've only had the card for a week or so, but after getting these things ironed out in day one, it's not been a problem at all. Even streaming to my Steam Deck in the living room via Moonlight/Sunshine has been 100% fine. I don't usually write reviews, but I'm rooting for AMD (even if they're *still* a bit over priced). I also hope these troubleshooting steps being in one place might help another person. If I notice anything horrible with the experience in the coming months, I'll post an update.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best option for 1440p this gen
reviews.reviewText: Great card, very quiet. Good build quality. The only thing to be careful about is it's HUGE, so make sure you have a case that can handle a 13 inch beast.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Got for my friend, couldn’t be happier
reviews.reviewText: Fits in an ASUS AP201 case!Able to get 4K/60 on most games (but not all—so be aware). 7800 XT is probably best bang for your buck card this generation.It’s easy to miss but there is a dual-BIOS switch on this card that has no label. But if you’ve already installed the card and can’t access the switch, don’t worry. There is no performance difference between them.Main gripe is that the fans are a bit loud, but that’s been my experience with all XFX cards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars XFX Speedster QICK319 RX 7800 XT
reviews.reviewText: So far its has been a very nice GPU with 16g it has plenty of vram. My only problem now is I need to update my Motherboard and CPU seeing my current setup is an older 9th gen Intel PCie 3.0.

La tarjeta funciona excelente, muy buena temperatura a la que trabaja y silenciosa, incluso a 4k funciona de maravilla. Tenia mis dudas para adquirirla por la fama de los drivers de AMD, pero ahora que veo como funciona la tarjeta y los drivers, me doy cuenta que la gente tiende a exagerar. Esta marca XFX no es muy comercial en mi país por lo que generaba también algunas dudas, pero me ha sorprendido lo bien la hechura. La recomiendo 100%.Excelente vendedor, la tarjeta llego antes de lo programado por Amazon.

Alors que dire, ba NR INFO sont des professionnels sérieux.Envoie rapide et livraison aussi .Au sujet de la carte j' aime beaucoup sont côté sobre et efficace, venant d'une 5700xt ba c'est le jour et la nuit je suis en 1440 p et j'ai un sérieux gap de performance.Le prix est toujours cher mais bon c est dans l air du temps de nous faire gonfler les prix. En revanche NR Info sont vraiment les meilleurs rapport prix perfEt temps que NVIDIA prendra du LSD pour appliquer ses prix je ne suis pas prêt de retourner chez eux

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It is my first experience with AMD video cards. Ordered this one as one of the available for the good price. Everything works fine and arrives very quickly. Recommended!

Best value card for me when compared to its competitors (Other models of same card and the NVIDIA 4070). It’s Not a loud card. Temperatures are normal (even in high stress situations). Can easily reach and maintain high fps in new shooters (I have capped at 240). I switched from NVIDIA RTX 2080 and the upgrade is very clear. Even the software side has improved a lot. I have used AMD adrenaline software before with bad experiences. I would recommend leaving off most of the Adrenaline software “performance boosting” settings. Don’t forget the benefits of the extra VRAM this card offer compared to the competitors.

Ottima scheda per il 2k. A mio parere non c’è di meglio se non si è interessati al ray tracing. Per quello si opta per la 470 a 100 euro in più (che comunque ha performance leggermente inferiori non ray traced rispetto a questa amd).Ottimo anche il setup tre ventole che permette oltre ad un raffreddamento adeguato anche un rumore molto contenuto
